notes.title: Expanding the Classics Collection
notes.content: Considering adding more volumes to the Great Books of the Western World collection. Need to research newer editions and potentially include more diverse authors.

notes.title: Digital vs. Physical Books
notes.content: Contemplating the balance between digital and physical books in the library. Digital offers convenience, but physical books provide a unique reading experience.

notes.title: Organizing Philosophy Section
notes.content: Planning to reorganize the philosophy section by schools of thought rather than chronologically. This might provide a better overview of philosophical developments.

notes.title: Collecting Penguin Classics
notes.content: I recently came to discover my perennial disdain for annotations was likely due to the immensely expensive (for a book that is) collectors editions I own. To offset this I will be moving to performing my literary analysis in books again except this type with penguin classics. They are cheap, feel good in the hand, and have ravishing cover art. They make the annotations themselves a addition rather than a impediment.

notes.title: Got Pandora's Box on Blu-ray!!!
notes.content: Found a beautiful edition of Pandora's Box on Blu-ray. $20 well spent. Mint condition, and finally got to kick off my criterion collection.
